quizz_info_1: Baclofen is a GABA agonist used as a skeletal muscle relaxant. Though it is commercialized in its racemic form, it is believed that only the R enantiomer is active. Since 2002, baclofen is giving promising results for treatment of alcoholism. A 2016 study suggest that only the R enantiomer is responsible for suppressing alcohol-motivated behaviors.
quizz_info_2: For more details on this synthesis, see:  Synthetic Commun. 1997, 27, 2455–2465. For more information about alcoholism’s treatment, see: Alcohol and Alcoholism 2002, 37, 504-508 and Front. Psychiatry 2016, 7, 68.

cards.condition: Zn-Cu, POCl3, Cl3CCOCl, Et2O, rt, 20 h
